intro: Siphonanthus cuneifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved siphonanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen through symbiotic relationships with soil bacteria. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
